I wouldn't rate Wikipedia close to a professional job like Encyclopaedia Britannica.
 
 Here's a couple of amusing howlers on Wikipedia I read about a while ago. There's the case of Climbing Jack, an April Fool's joke article that lingered for eight months before being removed. Another example is Erdosville, Nebraska. Since the town does not exist, it should have been simple to detect and remove references to a notable but non-existent place. But the entry stayed up for over a year and a real estate agent advertised being able to sell houses near "world famous Erdosville". 
 
 Due to the selection bias of authors and editors in Wikipedia, there is a weird ordering of priorities. For instance the entry on Britney Spears is (or was) the same length as the article on Henry VIII (13 pages). There are nearly two hundred entries for Battlestar Galactica. This includes particulars not only on each of the actors, but articles on each of the characters, technology, and even the religion portrayed in the show. 
 
 I shall continue to use Wikipedia as a quick reference to other sources of information.
 
 James.
